content: The Act titled "Belarus Democracy Reauthorization Act of 2006" amends the findings of the Belarus Democracy Act of 2004, highlighting the government's violations of human rights and democratic principles, particularly in the flawed presidential and parliamentary elections of 2006. The 2006 presidential elections in Belarus did not meet OSCE commitments for democratic elections, with widespread detentions and disregard for basic rights. Lukashenka's regime maintained power through an illegal referendum, imposing a new constitution and extending his term. The government failed to make a credible effort towards democracy. The Government of Belarus, under Lukashenka's regime, has failed to address the disappearances of opposition figures and journalists. Numerous political opposition figures have been imprisoned or faced labor sentences for their activities, while hundreds of pro-democratic activists have also been targeted. The Lukashenka regime in Belarus has targeted pro-democratic activists, harassed independent media, and suppressed freedom of speech. They have also cracked down on civil society by closing NGOs and trade unions. The Lukashenka regime in Belarus has targeted minority and unregistered religious communities, as well as human rights and pro-democracy activists, through harassment, fines, denials of religious services, and other forms of intimidation. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 is being amended to address these issues. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 is being amended to include a new section stating the policy of the United States to support democracy, human rights, and the release of political prisoners in Belarus. SEC. 4. ASSISTANCE TO PROMOTE DEMOCRACY AND CIVIL SOCIETY IN BELARUS. The United States aims to support democracy, human rights, and the release of political prisoners in Belarus, refusing to accept flawed elections and working towards the integration of Belarus into the European community of democracies. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 is amended to support the pursuit of freedom, democracy, and human rights, promote free, fair, and transparent elections with independent observers, and focus on developing a democratic political culture and civil society. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 is amended to expand independent media, support civil society development, aid human rights defenders, and enhance democratic political parties. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 is amended to support independent trade unions, human rights defenders, democratic political parties, and transparent electoral processes. Authorization of appropriations is also updated for 2007 and 2008. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 is amended to include radio and television broadcasting to Belarus. Sanctions against the government of Belarus are also addressed. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 is amended to include sanctions against the government of Belarus until specific conditions are met, such as the release of jailed individuals based on political or religious beliefs. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 calls for the release of jailed individuals based on political or religious beliefs, withdrawal of politically motivated charges against opposition activists and journalists, accountability for disappearances of opposition leaders and journalists, cessation of harassment against independent media and political opposition, and prosecution of responsible individuals. The Belarus Democracy Act of 2004 calls for accountability for fraudulent elections, embezzlement of state assets, and holding free and fair elections in Belarus. It also includes provisions for denying entry into the United States for senior leadership of the Belarusian government. The President can deny entry into the US for aliens connected to the Belarusian government or benefiting financially from actions undermining democracy in Belarus. The Trade and Development Agency should not allocate funds for activities in Belarus. The Secretary of the Treasury should oppose any multilateral financial assistance to Belarus through international financial institutions.
